Description: Small fragment of a relatively small scarab, made of steatite, with a greenish-turquoise glaze preserved. Prothorax and elytra are divided by a single line, one humeral callosity is preserved at the left side. Parts of the head preserved, probably trapezoidal in shape. The rest is broken off.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D16.U and P, level 1, mound β
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
